Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 3; Esri ArcCatalog 8.3.0.800
en World Rivers is a line theme representing the major rivers within the world. World Rivers provides a base map layer of major rivers of the world. Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:15,000,000.

0.106 0.106 SDC ArcGIS software The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

Esri Redlands, California, USA

3000000, 25000000 CD-ROM
19920801
publication date
ArcWorld 1:3M, 1:25M Attribute and geospatial data
The following steps were performed by Esri for Data & Maps 2002: Downloaded Sea of Aral image from http://visibleearth.nasa.gov/data/ev89/ev8936_AralSea.A2001165.0710.250m.jpg. Locally registered the image to the vector data using ArcView GIS Image Analysis creating shapefiles of the current water area. These shapefiles were used as the basis for updating the current extent of the rivers leading to the sea. Copied ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), ArcView GIS legend file (.avl), and projection file (.prj) and created spatial indices.
The following steps were performed by Esri: Extracted the features from ArcWorld 1:25M. Aligned the mouths of rivers with coastlines. Made features consistent with all political boundaries they are coincident with. Added attribute values from the Rand McNally New International Atlas, the Times Atlas of the World, the Digital Chart of the World, and World Resources Institute. Added St. Lawrence system from ArcWorld 1:3M. Generalized to match detail of the Cntry00.shp. Removed unneeded attributes. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr). Created ArcView GIS legend file (.avl). Created projection file (.prj). Ran ArcView GIS Avenue™ request ExportClean, and created spatial indices. The following steps were performed by Esri: Downloaded all image sources from the online links. Locally registered the images to the vector data using ArcView GIS Image Analysis creating shapefiles of the current water areas. These shapefiles were used as the basis for updating the current extent of the rivers leading to these water areas. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices. Converted the data set to SDC. NASA Visible Earth NASA Earth Observatory JSC DIC SouthWestern Bell WorldRoom http://landsat7.usgs.gov ArcView GIS 3, ArcView GIS Image Analysis, ArcGIS 8 Earthshots from the EROS 20020925
The following steps were performed by Esri: Added KILOMETERS attribute and calculated its values. Added MILES attribute and calculated its values. ArcView GIS 3, ArcGIS 9 20040307
The following steps were performed by Esri: Deleted the shoreline (lake) features. The MILES and KILOMETERS attribute values were not recalculated. Reduced the attribute widths for NAME and SYSTEM. Corrected a spelling error.ArcView GIS 3, ArcGIS 920050215
The positional accuracy is unknown.
The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry. After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
